name: Religious Service
description: A character can spend time performing religious service at a temple or shrine. Between rites and prayers, the character earns favors from the organization.
requirements: Access to a temple, shrine, or religious community that will accept the character's service
Alignment or behavior compatible with the temple's values (DM discretion)
resolution: At the end of each workweek, the character makes three checks: Intelligence (Religion), Wisdom (Insight), and Charisma (Persuasion). Compare successes to failures.

checks.description: Knowledge of religious doctrine and rites.
Understanding the needs of the faithful and reading the congregation.
Inspiring worshippers and building connections within the temple.

results.result: No favors earned. The character may have offended some members of the temple.
The character earns three favors and gains a reputation within the temple.

favorExamples: A favor can be spent to request healing or other magical services from the temple
A favor can grant political support from the temple for a specific cause
A favor can provide shelter and lodging for the character and allies
A favor can grant access to restricted areas or secret knowledge held by the temple
